instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Display No Lights
threads.message:
Hello sulit here again.

I have another macbook air no display green light present.Upon checking putting usb to chime,no display but fan is spinning.

Tested Components
F7700=8.5v
L7701=0v
<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>=0v
<RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR>=0v

For those who have an experties for this issue please help me.

Thanks

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Display No Lights
threads.message:
Do you get image at least?
Caps Lock light reacts?
Do you have USB activity?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Display No Lights
threads.message:
I did not get an image.USB No Activity no Lights
and Keyboard Lights not working also.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Display No Lights
threads.message:
No reason to check the backlight circuit then.

Do you get voltage on all coils?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Display No Lights
threads.message: In many of his youtube videos for beginners Louis starts by checking different voltages (page 62 in schematics). Usually first step is to check these voltages to find out which is missing.
